Package Parsers

Class CommandParser

java.lang.Object
Parsers.CommandParser
public class CommandParser
extends java.lang.Object
The class checks the commands against an array of Command Objects and executes them returning true if all have executed correctly.
Since:
04/01/20
Version:
1.0
Author:
George Lloyd-Anderson

  • Method Details

    • runCommands

      public java.lang.Boolean runCommands​(java.lang.String writtencommand, java.util.ArrayList<Command> commands, javax.swing.JTextArea jta, c3461288_Coursework_Masters.Pannels.CanvasPannel canvasPannel, CommandFactory commandfactory) throws exceptions.NullCommandException, exceptions.IncorrectNumberofParamatersException, exceptions.InvalidParamatersException, exceptions.OpeningTagNotFoundException, exceptions.VariableNotFoundException, exceptions.UnclosedTagException, exceptions.DuplicateVariableException, exceptions.CommandNotFoundException
      The CommandParser class has one public method "runCommands" which looks through the code and executes the commands added. the method follows 5 main steps
      1) Loop through the users commands and create any relevant objects for "Methods", "Loops" , "Variables" and "IfStatements"
      2) Process the tags mentioned in [1] for example run the loops adding the relevant commands inside for the number required and any commands needing removing are set to "deadcode"
      3) Remove the tags, comments and deadcode from the array by adding everything else to a new filteredarray.
      4) Loop through the filtered array and check the commands and parameters adding all correct commands to an approvedcommands array
      5) Finally for each of the approved commands their name is passed to the command factory and the returned command is executed.
      Parameters:
      writtencommand - Contains the commands entered by the user.
      commands - Contains all the Valid Command Objects.
      jta - Contains the JText Area console.
      canvasPannel - Contains the canvas panel in which to draw in.
      commandfactory - Contains the commandfactoryclass used to generate objects and execute them.
      Returns:
      true if all the commands have executed successfully.
      Throws:
      exceptions.NullCommandException - Thrown when the array writtencommand contains no commands or comments.
      exceptions.IncorrectNumberofParamatersException - Thrown when the incorrect number of parameters are entered for a command.
      exceptions.InvalidParamatersException - Thrown when the parameters for a command are invalid.
      exceptions.OpeningTagNotFoundException - Thrown when an end tag is called without a corresponding start tag.
      exceptions.VariableNotFoundException - Thrown when a command uses an invalid variable.
      exceptions.UnclosedTagException - Thrown when an opening tag is created without a corresponding closing tag.
      exceptions.DuplicateVariableException - Thrown when a command tries to create a variable where the name already exists.
      exceptions.CommandNotFoundException - Thrown when a command is entered which is not a valid command.
